abstract: World Bank report says digital technologies are expanding in world, but economic opportunities, including 'digital dividends' like basic public services and employment have fallen behind in some countries; points out 60 percent of world's population has no Internet access.

headline.main: Internet Yields Uneven Dividends and May Widen Inequality, Report Says

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

snippet: The vast changes wrought by technology have not expanded economic opportunities or improved access to basic public services in ways that many had expected.
lead_paragraph: The vast changes wrought by technology have not expanded economic opportunities or improved access to basic public services in ways that many had expected.
